newsitem.title: UK: BP sees 5 pct annual oil production growth.
newsitem.headline: BP sees 5 pct annual oil production growth.

text.p: British Petroleum said on Tuesday it expected its oil production to grow by an annual five percent in the medium term.
Fields in Alaska, the Gulf of Mexico, Venezuela and west of the Shetlands should be the motors for higher oil output, chief executive John Browne said.
"They should enable us to post production growth of about five percent a year in the medium term," he told reporters after BP earlier announced a 30 percent increase in its 1996 net profit.
BP, which raised its total dividend by 28 percent to 19.5 pence per share, said weather permitting, it expected to start production at the Atlantic Foinaven field soon.
"Give us four weeks of good weather and we'll see oil from Foinaven," said Dick Olver, deputy chief executive of BP Exploration.
Foinanven, which is the first field to be developed west of the Shetland Islands, was originally scheduled to come onstream in June. But the start-up date was postponed following technical problems.
Production in the first stage of Foinaven is expected to be 120,000 barrels per day.
BP said it expected the new Schiehallion oilfield, which is also located in Atlantic waters, to come onstream in mid-1998.
